original_title: Sri Lanka Supreme Court orders finance min secy, AG not to withhold funds for local polls
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Supreme Court has issued an interim order preventing the Finance Ministry Secretary and the Attorney General from withholding funds allocated for the now-postponed local government elections.
The apex court issued the order Friday March 03 afternoon after taking up a petition filed by main opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) general secretary and MP Ranjith Madduma Bandara.

Opposition Tamil National Alliance (TNA) legislator M A Sumanthiran tweeted after the verdict that he hoped the national election commission would fix a date for the polls before the legally mandated March 19.

The Supreme Court delivers an interim order restraining the Min of Finance @RW_UNP et al from withholding funds to conduct LG Elections in the case filed by @sjbsrilanka Gen Sec @MaddumaBandaraR a little while ago. Hope the #EC fixes the date before legally mandated 19th March!
SJM MP Harsha de Silva said following the verdict that it is now clear why he was removed from the chairmanship of the parliamentary Committee on Public Finance (COPF).
“I had requested the Secretary to the Treasury to be present at parliament COPF this week to discuss Sri Lanka revenue and expenditure,” he tweeted.
